(N±1)-Electron States Solver (fd_greens.main.eh_states_solver)

class EHStatesSolver(h: fd_greens.qiskit_ver.main.molecular_hamiltonian.MolecularHamiltonian, ansatz_func_e: Callable[[Sequence[float]], qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit] = <function build_ansatz_e>, ansatz_func_h: Callable[[Sequence[float]], qiskit.circuit.quantumcircuit.QuantumCircuit] = <function build_ansatz_h>, q_instance: Optional[qiskit.utils.quantum_instance.QuantumInstance] = None, spin: str = 'd', method: str = 'exact', h5fname: str = 'lih')[source]

Bases: object

A class to calculate and store information of (N±1)-electron states.

Initializes an EHStatesSolver object.

Parameters

  • h – The molecular Hamiltonian.

  • ansatz_func_e – The ansatz function for (N+1)-electron states.

  • ansatz_func_h – The ansatz function for (N-1)-electron states.

  • q_instance – The quantum instance for (N±1)-electron state calculation.

  • spin – A character indicating whether up spins ('u') or down spins ('d') are included.

  • method – The method to calculate the (N+/-1)-electron states. Either exact ('exact') or VQE ('vqe').

  • h5fname – The HDF5 file name.

run_exact() → None[source]

Calculates the exact (N+/-1)-electron energies and states of the Hamiltonian.

run_vqe() → None[source]

Calculates the (N±1)-electron energies and states of the Hamiltonian using VQE.

save_data() → None[source]

Saves (N±1)-electron energies and states to HDF5 file.

run(method: Optional[str] = None) → None[source]

Runs the (N±1)-electron states calculation.

Parameters

exact (The method to calculate the excited states. Either) –
